strings.Value: [Help the blacksmith] "All right, on three. One, two..."
"You killed this beast on your own? I'm impressed."
"It's fortunate we're by your smithy. I have an urgent purchase to make."
{n}Beneath the crushing weight of a monster carcass lies a guard — unconscious and bleeding, but still alive.{/n} "Your Grace! He's wounded. Help me get him out before he loses too much blood!"

{n}Gathering all your strength, you and the blacksmith manage to lift the monster's bulk off the ground and drag the guard out from beneath it.{/n} "Phew... Lad's been within a hair's breadth of dyin'. He makes it to end of the battle, he should call this his second birthday!"
"Didn't you hear? The man's wounded! You got a stone where your heart should be?"
{n}The guard's wounds rapidly close. The blacksmith nods in gratitude.{/n}

"Well, I was sittin' in my smithy. I heard some shoutin' in the street, so I grabbed my maul and headed out. Saw THIS ugly mug throw that poor guard to the ground and get a huge bite in, so I gave it a good whack to the head. Then another, and another, and so on until it stopped movin'. Wasn't strong enough to pull the lad free from under its fat belly, though — good thing you showed up."
{n}The blacksmith's face twists in distaste.{/n} "Aye, I can fight all right. Just don't like to."
"Thanks for the help! I'll get him somewhere safe."
"So you decided to help me after all?"
